item.title: [ReQ] Need Simple autoclicker script
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

leader, GhostMouse sucks now. It doesn’t have even repeating feature, so you have to be tricky to make it repeat… Even though, it is not that tricky.

But anyways… Tasker is way better than GhostMouse(, because it’s newer)… GhostMouse is really old, but yeah, it WAS good back then.

You can download tasker from here:
http://www.majorgeeks.com/download.php?det=669

and yes, it is shareware. So here is something nice:

[code]Name: REVENGE Crew

Serial Numbers:

1144T9611

or

4289T4134

or

8944T9698[/code]

But I guess you are wanting to detect something, so autoclickers/recorders wont work… Maybe someone of us should check out the game.

item.title: [ReQ] Need Simple autoclicker script
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

Here is one too…

[scar]var
x, y: Integer;

const
WaitTime = 100;

procedure Click;
begin
if (IsFKeyDown(11)) then
begin
repeat
GetMousePos(x, y);
HoldMouse(x + 1, y + 1, True);
Wait(50 + Random(15));
ReleaseMouse(x + 1, y + 1, True);
Wait(WaitTime);
until (IsFKeyDown(12));
end;
end;

begin
repeat
Click;
until (False);
end.[/scar]

Shortly:
Press play in SCAR…
Hit F11 key when you want script to start clicking for you
…aaaand hit F12 key when you want script to stop the clicking.

If you want you can also change the wait time between clicks. (( waittime = TheTimeHere; ))

Thanks to Can about explaining how to fix the bug with x and y coordinate!

Edit: and here is a clicker with couple simple options…

[scar]var
x, y: Integer;

const
WaitTime = 100; // Time between clicks?
RWaitTime = 100; // Any random time? If NO, then change the number to 0.
Clicking = ‘Humanlike’; // “Humanlike” or UnHumanlike?

procedure HumanlikeClick;
begin
HoldMouse(x + 1, y + 1, True)
Wait(50 + Random(15))
ReleaseMouse(x + 1, y + 1, True);
end;

procedure UnHumanlikeClick;
begin
ClickMouse(x + 1, y + 1, True);
end;

procedure Casing;
begin
case Clicking of
‘Humanlike’: HumanlikeClick;
‘UnHumanlike’: UnHumanlikeClick;
end;
end;

procedure Click;
begin
if (IsFKeyDown(11)) then
begin
repeat
GetMousePos(x, y);
Casing;
Wait(WaitTime + Random(RWaitTime));
until (IsFKeyDown(12));
end;
end;

begin
repeat
Click;
until (False);
end.[/scar]

Same things to this one…

F11 to START and F12 to STOP.

Read full topic

item.title: [ReQ] Need Simple autoclicker script
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

[scar]
program phonnygoblin;
var
x,y:integer;
procedure phonnygoblin;
begin
getmousepos(x,y);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
begin
repeat
phonnygoblin;
wait(1000+(50));
until(false);
end.
[/scar]
btw thanx for rep. just move ur mouse over bandaids then press ctrl+alt+r or whatever your hotkey to run is.

Read full topic

item.title: [ReQ] Need Simple autoclicker script
item.dc:creator: @cygo cygo
item.description:
@cygo wrote:

use this, just position the mouse where you want it to autoclick, and wait a few seconds

[scar]
Program new;
var
x,y,a:integer;
begin
wait(15000);
getmousepos(x,y);
a:=0;
repeat
a:=a+1;
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(100);
until(a=100);
end.
[/scar]

Read full topic
